group_1.textLeft: It’s not uncommon in other towns for people to @just suddenly disappear, y’know?

group_1.textRight: It would seem so, wouldn’t it.

group_1.textLeft: Since none of us have ever left the village,
we have only heard about that...

group_1.textRight: But it’s NOT a coincidence. It’s a *curse*.
Because it also happened before that time.

group_1.textLeft: On the day when I appeared in this village, another person disappeared.
Out of all of us here, only Ryoko-san knew her...

group_1.textRight: ...I have fond memories of her. She was a super @caring type.
When I first came to the village, not knowing @anything, pretty much like a newborn baby chick,
she taught me everything, from how to draw water @to how to cook rice.
She was like my great senpai in life.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks to her teachings on how to draw well water,
all of us, even now, are able to live comfortably.

group_1.textRight: ...Hm? Well water?

group_1.textLeft: Are you guys dependent on well water here?

group_1.textRight: Naturally, right?
The tea you’re drinking right now is a roast that was picked from the garden.
At night, for a bath, we boil water in a cauldron @using firewood.
You’re, like, survival experts!

group_1.textLeft: So what do you do for food and stuff?

group_1.textRight: In the mornings, we go out to the fields where @edible plants grow,
and then we cook and eat those.
...I do wonder, in other towns,
how do people live their lives there?

group_1.textLeft: Well, it depends on the town.

group_1.textRight: For water and baths, ya twist a faucet and water @comes out.
When you’re out on the road, if ya go into a store @ya can get food.
Does the food in the store eventually run out...?

group_1.textLeft: I’ve never seen a store run out of stock...

group_1.textRight: Why, thinking about it some more...
The crops grow in the field by themselves... @Isn’t that strange?

group_1.textLeft: Look, isn’t this ceiling light pretty much the same?

group_1.textRight: That’s true, it lights up automatically as soon as the room gets dark.
Is it the same in other towns?

group_1.textLeft: Yup, the towns are always lit up even when no one’s around!

group_1.textRight: If I consider that, it really is unbelievable...
Who in the world made the towns and villages @this way?

group_1.textLeft: There’s a legend that three sages created this @world...

group_1.textRight: I’ve heard that before too, from the experienced @senpai I just mentioned.
...Though it seems senpai got it from her senpai @who got it from a traveller!
Ah, sorry...
I’m talking about someone you guys don’t know, @would be easy to feel alienated...
What’s up with this “alienated” thing...?

group_1.textLeft: It’s like that feeling of loneliness you get when @you’re not part of the group?

group_1.textRight: My bad...
I’m the only one who still knows of her now.
So I unintentionally end up wanting to share more.
